cluster_relations.rel_desc: Pollination is the process that enables reproduction in certain plant species.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject reproductive process (e.g., pollination) functionally enables or is necessary for the reproduction and population maintenance of the object plant species.
Subject pollinator transfers pollen between individuals of the object plant taxon, contributing to its reproduction.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Pollination mutualism: nectar reward for pollen transfer

cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject pollinator transfers pollen between individuals of the object plant taxon, contributing to its reproduction.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Pollination mutualism: nectar reward for pollen transfer

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Bird pollinators support the reproduction of many plant species; without them, these plants would struggle.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (organism, agent, or process) functionally enables or supports the reproductive success and population maintenance of the object species.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: in the absence of bird pollinators
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Effect: struggle to reproduce and maintain their populations

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (organism, agent, or process) functionally enables or supports the reproductive success and population maintenance of the object species.
args.justification: The relation where pollination affects plant species reproduction has the same semantics as the relation where bird pollinators support plant reproduction. Unifying both under the canonical predicate 'facilitates_reproduction_of' avoids redundant predicates ('enables_reproduction_of' vs 'facilitates_reproduction_of') and better reflects a general functional support/enablement relation that applies to both processes and organisms.
args.remark: Aligned with RelR_a4614ed123fb so that all reproductive support/enablement relations share the same canonical predicate.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (organism, agent, or process) functionally enables or supports the reproductive success and population maintenance of the object species.
executed_decisions.justification: The relation where pollination affects plant species reproduction has the same semantics as the relation where bird pollinators support plant reproduction. Unifying both under the canonical predicate 'facilitates_reproduction_of' avoids redundant predicates ('enables_reproduction_of' vs 'facilitates_reproduction_of') and better reflects a general functional support/enablement relation that applies to both processes and organisms.
executed_decisions.remark: Aligned with RelR_a4614ed123fb so that all reproductive support/enablement relations share the same canonical predicate.
